summary: Email chain between US Attorney's Office personnel discussing victim notification procedures for the Jeffrey Epstein criminal case (USA v. Jeffrey Epstein, Docket 19-CR-00490) ahead of his scheduled arraignment. The correspondence reveals coordination efforts to identify victims and provide them with legal notifications, noting that many victims already have legal representation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case USA v. Jeffrey Epstein, indicted by the USAO in the Southern District of New York, with an arraignment scheduled.

events.title: Epstein arraignment scheduled
events.description: The arraignment for Jeffrey Epstein in case 19-CR-00490 was scheduled for the Monday following this email correspondence (July 15, 2019).

events.title: Victim notification coordination
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel coordinated to send notification letters to victims of Jeffrey Epstein, discussing methods (email vs. mail) and the process of identifying new victims.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated July 12, 2019, regarding victim notification for the criminal case USA v. Jeffrey Epstein (Docket 19-CR-00490).
Jeffrey Epstein had been indicted by the US Attorney's Office (USAO) in the Southern District of New York, with an arraignment scheduled for the following Monday (July 15, 2019).
The correspondence reveals that many victims already had legal representation, and notification to them had to go through their attorneys.
The USAO was working to identify new victims and add them to the Victim Notification System (VNS) for official updates.
The email discusses logistical challenges in contacting victims, specifically the lack of email addresses for most, prompting a shift to traditional mail ('snail mail') for notifications.
